duties_responsibilities.duty: Ensure safe and secure living conditions for all residents, handling emergencies, maintenance issues, and complaints.
Perform nightly security checks, lock up common areas, and respond to building emergencies during on-call shifts.
Log and document serious events on incident reports, respond to tenant complaints, and maintain building cleanliness.
Respond to telephone calls and emergencies in a timely manner, attend resident meetings, and follow policies and procedures.
Contribute to a safe and pleasant work environment, follow safe work practices, and perform other duties as assigned.

education_certification.credential: Bilingual in English and Chinese, sensitivity to issues facing low-income tenants, good judgment and problem-solving skills.
Residency in resident manager unit and commitment to respond to cell phone/pager calls and be at the property site within specified time frames.
Good written and verbal communication skills, ability to work under stressful circumstances, and prior experience as a resident manager (preferred).
Familiarity with affordable housing projects and commitment to substantially benefit the property through the day job.
